alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 3:29AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following counties, Douglas and Franklin. * WHEN...Until 915 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 320 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain earlier this morning due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding due to the earlier heavy rainfall. NWS Doppler Radar has shown Between 1 to 3 inches of rain have fallen since Midnight. - Additional rainfall amounts up to one half inch are expected over the area through 8 AM CDT. This additional rain may continue minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ottawa, Baldwin City, Wellsville, Centropolis, Pomona, Lone Star, Pleasant Grove, Globe and Vinland.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
